intro: Randia accedens, commonly known as the small randia or red randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, simple leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, fleshy fruits that are typically red or orange when mature. Randia accedens is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
